Hope you have a great day in DE, love you! |date=2019-06-18 |access-date=2024-06-21 |language=en-us |location=[[Stagecoach Festival]] in [[Indio, California]] |link=https://www.instagram.com/p/By2ZP5MnvsS/?img_index=1 |df=mdy}}</ref><ref name="birthday">{{Cite Instagram |postid=By3vBuGn0C_ |user=tasteofcountry |title=@JimmieAllen a very #HappyBirthday to YOU! |date=2019-06-18 |author=Taste of Country |author-link=Townsquare Media |access-date=2024-06-21 |language=en-us |link=https://www.instagram.com/p/By3vBuGn0C_/ |df=mdy}}</ref> is an American [[country music]] singer and songwriter. He was signed to [[Broken Bow Records]] imprint Stoney Creek, for which he released the two singles "[[Best Shot]]" and "[[Make Me Want To]]" and the 2018 album ''[[Mercury Lane]]''. In 2021, he won the [[Country Music Association Award for New Artist of the Year]], the second black artist to do so (in 2009, [[Darius Rucker]] was the first). Allen was dropped by Broken Bow in June 2023 amid sexual assault allegations.

==Early life==
Allen was born in [[Milton, Delaware]], United States, but moved to [[Nashville, Tennessee]], in 2007.<ref name="stone">{{cite web|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country/see-rising-country-singer-jimmie-allens-smooth-rendition-of-best-shot-200654/|title=See Rising Country Singer Jimmie Allen's Smooth Rendition of 'Best Shot'|work=Rolling Stone Country|date=27 February 2018|access-date=July 12, 2018}}</ref> During most of his first few years in Nashville, he experienced poverty and often lived out of his car.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.soundslikenashville.com/news/jimmie-allen-perseverance-music-life/|title=Jimmie Allen Embodies Perseverance in Music and Life|last=Houghton|first=Cillea|work=Sounds Like Nashville|date=2 March 2018|access-date=July 12, 2018}}</ref><ref name="billboard"/> He auditioned for the [[American Idol (season 10)|tenth season]] of ''[[American Idol]]'', but was cut before the live voting rounds. While on ''[[American Idol]]'', he performed with [[Colton Dixon]] during one of the group rounds<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.capegazette.com/article/cape-grad-jimmie-allen-reflects-american-idol/8927|first=Ryan |last=Mavity|title=Cape grad Jimmie Allen reflects on 'American Idol'|work=[[Cape Gazette]]|date=March 7, 2011|access-date=January 23, 2019}}</ref> and befriended [[Scotty McCreery]], who eventually won the competition that year. Allen and McCreery later reconnected and toured together after the release of Allen's debut album.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://tasteofcountry.com/scotty-mccreerys-jimmie-allen-tour-american-idol/|first=Billy|last= Dukes|title=Scotty McCreery's Tour with Jimmie Allen is Seven Years in the Making|work=[[Taste of Country]]|date=August 31, 2018|access-date=January 23, 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://chicago.suntimes.com/entertainment/scotty-mccreery-success-music-marriage-gabi-dugal-chicago-concert/|first=Tricia|last=Despres|title=Scotty McCreery riding a tidal wave of success in music, life|newspaper=[[Chicago Sun-Times]]|date=December 7, 2018|access-date=January 23, 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://abcnewsradioonline.com/music-news/2019/1/25/scotty-mccreery-reveals-jimmie-allen-is-his-brother-from-ame.html#entry36151452|title=Scotty McCreery reveals Jimmie Allen is his brother from "American Idol" -- but he still stole his puppy|work=[[ABC News Radio]]|date=January 25, 2019|access-date=January 25, 2019|archive-date=October 26, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201026090748/http://abcnewsradioonline.com/music-news/2019/1/25/scotty-mccreery-reveals-jimmie-allen-is-his-brother-from-ame.html#entry36151452|url-status=dead}}</ref>

==Career==
Allen signed a publishing deal with Wide Open Music, a songwriting imprint formed by singer-songwriter [[Ash Bowers]], in 2016.<ref name="billboard"/> After doing a talent showcase for representatives of [[Broken Bow Records]] in early 2017,<ref name="billboard"/> he was signed to that label's Stoney Creek imprint and released his self-titled debut EP, which Bowers produced.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/jimmie-allen-ep/1289945938|title=Jimmie Allen EP|work=iTunes Store|access-date=July 12, 2018}}</ref><ref name="allmusic"/> The label's executive vice president said that the decision to sign Allen was one of the fastest they ever made at the label.<ref name="stone"/> [[Stephen Thomas Erlewine]] of [[AllMusic]] compared the EP's sound to the "slick, assured style" of [[Thomas Rhett]] and [[Sam Hunt]].<ref name="allmusic">{{cite web|url=https://www.allmusic.com/artist/jimmie-allen-mn0003672595/biography|title=Jimmie Allen biography|website=[[AllMusic]]|access-date=July 12, 2018}}</ref> Similarly, ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' Country writer Brittney McKenna compared Allen's [[contemporary R&B]] influences to those artists and [[Maren Morris]].<ref name="stone"/> A track from the EP, "Blue Jean Baby", was added to [[Spotify]]'s "United States Viral 50 chart".<ref name="stone"/>

His first official single, "[[Best Shot]]", was released in early 2018. The week of its release, it was the second most-added song to country music radio playlists.<ref name="stone"/> The song has made the [[Hot Country Songs]], [[Country Airplay]], and [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] charts and was made into a music video.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cmt.com/news/1795130/jimmie-allen-gives-life-and-love-his-best-shot/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180522083413/http://www.cmt.com/news/1795130/jimmie-allen-gives-life-and-love-his-best-shot/|url-status=dead|archive-date=May 22, 2018|title=Jimmie Allen Gives Life and Love His "Best Shot"|last=Stephens|first=Samantha|work=CMT|access-date=July 12, 2018}}</ref> Allen said that the song's title and central theme were inspired by his grandmother and his son, who was 4 at the time of the song's release.<ref>{{cite magazine| url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country/see-rising-country-singer-jimmie-allens-smooth-rendition-of-best-shot-200654/ | title=See Rising Country Singer Jimmie Allen's Smooth Rendition of 'Best Shot' | magazine=[[Rolling Stone]] | date=February 27, 2018 | access-date=October 17, 2018 | first=Brittney|last= McKenna}}</ref><ref name="billboard"/> His debut album, ''[[Mercury Lane]]'', was issued in October 2018.<ref name="allmusic"/> Also produced by Bowers, the album takes its name from the street on which Allen lived as a child.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://theboot.com/jimmie-allen-debut-album-mercury-lane-details-information/ | title=Everything we know about Jimmie Allen's debut album, 'Mercury Lane' | website=Theboot.com | date=October 5, 2018 | access-date=October 17, 2018 | first=Liv |last=Stecker}}</ref> "Best Shot" was a Number One hit on the ''[[Billboard charts|Billboard]]'' [[Country Airplay]] chart in November 2018, making him the first Black artist to send his debut single to the top of that chart.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.soundslikenashville.com/news/jimmie-allen-history-no1-best-shot/ | title=JIMMIE ALLEN MAKES HISTORY WITH NO.1 SINGLE 'BEST SHOT' | work=Sounds Like Nashville | date=19 November 2018 | access-date=November 20, 2018}}</ref> The album's second single, "[[Make Me Want To]]" released to country radio on February 1, 2019,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://theboot.com/jimmie-allen-make-me-want-to-song/|title=Hear Jimmie Allen's Swooning New Single, 'Make Me Want To'|last=Stecker|first=Liz|website=Theboot.com|date=January 8, 2019|access-date=January 30, 2019}}</ref> and it also became a Number One hit on the [[Country Airplay|''Billboard'' Country Airplay]] chart.

Allen also recorded a cover of [[Lady Gaga]] and [[Bradley Cooper]]'s "[[Shallow (Lady Gaga and Bradley Cooper song)|Shallow]]" with [[Abby Anderson]] in May 2019. The recording was made into a video as well.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nashcountrydaily.com/2019/02/22/jimmie-allen-abby-anderson-cover-lady-gaga-bradley-coopers-shallow-from-a-star-is-born/|title=Jimmie Allen & Abby Anderson Cover Lady Gaga & Bradley Cooper's "Shallow" From "A Star Is Born"|date=February 22, 2019|newspaper=Nash Country Daily|access-date=2020-04-03|archive-date=2019-12-29|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20191229185315/http://www.nashcountrydaily.com/2019/02/22/jimmie-allen-abby-anderson-cover-lady-gaga-bradley-coopers-shallow-from-a-star-is-born/|url-status=dead}}</ref>

In 2020, Allen released "This Is Us", a duet with [[Noah Cyrus]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://music.apple.com/au/album/this-is-us-single/1497381776|title=This Is Us â€“ Single by Jimmie Allen & Noah Cyrus|website=Apple Music|date=21 February 2020|access-date=February 22, 2020}}</ref> It was included on his new EP, ''Bettie James'', which was released on July 10, 2020.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://people.com/country/jimmie-allen-releases-bettie-james-ep-project/|title=Jimmie Allen Teams with His Childhood Musical Heroes on His New EP: 'It's Been a Dream of Mine'|first=Nancy|last=Kruh|date=July 10, 2020|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|access-date=July 13, 2020}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.soundslikenashville.com/news/jimmie-allen-bettie-james-track-list/|title=Jimmie Allen Reveals Seven-Song 'Bettie James' EP Track List|first=Lauren|last=Laffer|date=July 8, 2020|publisher=Sounds Like Nashville|access-date=July 13, 2020}}</ref> The project's second single was "Freedom Was a Highway," a duet with [[Brad Paisley]], which was released on February 1, 2021.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.allaccess.com/country/future-releases|title=Future Releases for Country Radio Stations|publisher=All Access|access-date=August 1, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210125180525/https://www.allaccess.com/country/future-releases|archive-date=January 25, 2021}}</ref> It became Allen's third Number One hit and Paisley's twentieth on the [[Country Airplay|''Billboard'' Country Airplay]] in February 2022. 

Allen became the first Black solo performer to win New Male Artist of the Year at the [[55th Annual Country Music Association Awards|2021 ACM Awards]] (at which he also performed a duet with [[Brad Paisley]]).<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://wincountry.com/2021/04/16/ahead-of-the-acms-jimmie-allen-shares-his-vision-for-the-future-of-racial-equality-in-country-music/|title=Ahead of the ACMs, Jimmie Allen shares his vision for the future of racial equality in country music|website=Wincountry.com|access-date=16 February 2022}}{{Dead link|date=March 2023 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> In September 2021, Allen was announced as one of the celebrities competing on [[Dancing with the Stars (American season 30)|season 30]] of ''[[Dancing with the Stars (American TV series)|Dancing with the Stars]]''.<ref>{{Cite web|last=|first=|date=2021-09-08|title='Dancing With the Stars' 2021: Meet the season 30 celebrity cast|url=https://www.goodmorningamerica.com/culture/story/dancing-stars-2021-meet-season-30-celebrity-cast-79752719|access-date=2021-09-11|website=Good Morning America|language=en}}</ref> He and his partner Emma Slater were the ninth couple to be eliminated, ultimately placing 7th.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Duncan|first=Gabrielle|date=2021-11-08|title=DWTS: Who Was Sent Home in the Double Elimination?|url=https://people.com/tv/dwts-olivia-jade-and-jimmie-allen-exit-season-30-janet-jackson-night-double-elimination/|access-date=2021-11-23|website=People.com|language=en}}</ref>

On November 10, 2021, he won New Artist of the Year at the [[CMA Awards]].<ref>{{Cite web|last1=DeSantis|first1=Rachel|first2=Daniela|last2=Avila|date=2021-11-10|title=Jimmie Allen Delivers Tearful Speech After Winning New Artist of the Year at the 2021 CMAs|url=https://people.com/country/2021-cma-awards-jimmie-allen-wins-new-artist-of-the-year/|access-date=2021-11-23|website=People.com|language=en}}</ref> 15 days later, he performed at the [[Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade]].<ref>{{cite web |last1=Regan |first1=Jenny |title=2021 MACY'S THANKSGIVING PARADE: PHOTOS OF MICKEY GUYTON, DARREN CRISS & MORE |url=https://www.billboard.com/photos/2021-macys-thanksgiving-parade-mickey-guyton-darren-criss-1235002883/ |website=billboard.com |date=26 November 2021 |access-date=28 November 2021}}</ref> In February 2022, Allen announced that he would be a guest mentor on [[American Idol (season 20)|''American Idol'' (season 20)]].<ref>{{Cite magazine|last=Nicholson|first=Jessica|title=Jimmie Allen to Serve as 'American Idol' Season 20 Guest Mentor: See His Announcement Video|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/country/jimmie-allen-american-idol-season-20-guest-mentor-1235031966/|date=February 15, 2022|access-date=February 15, 2022|magazine=Billboard}}</ref>

He also featured on [[Noah Schnacky]]'s "Don't You Wanna Know" for his 2022 album ''Thoughtfully Reckless''<ref>{{cite web |first=Tricia |last=Despres |url=https://people.com/country/noah-schnacky-jimmie-allen-team-up-dont-you-wanna-know/ |title=Rising Star Noah Schnacky Teams Up with Jimmie Allen on 'Don't You Wanna Know': 'It Was Magic' |work=People |date=June 9, 2021}}</ref> and a duet with [[Nick Carter (musician)|Nick Carter]] in "Easy".<ref>{{Cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/music/country/backstreet-boys-nick-carter-jimmie-allen-easy-interview-1235028591/|title = Backstreet Boys' Nick Carter Talks Bonding with Jimmie Allen over Fatherhood While Making 'Easy'|magazine = [[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]|date = 11 February 2022}}</ref>

Allen release the lead-off single, "Down Home," to his third studio album ''[[Tulip Drive]]'' on March 8, 2022.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.jimmieallenmusic.com/jimmie-allen-announces-new-single-down-home/|title = JIMMIE ALLEN ANNOUNCES NEW SINGLE "DOWN HOME" | Jimmie Allen}}</ref> The album was released on June 24, 2022.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://themusicuniverse.com/jimmie-allen-announces-tulip-drive/|title=Jimmie Allen announces 'Tulip Drive'|first=Buddy|last=Iahn|website=themusicuniverse.com|date=4 April 2022|access-date=4 April 2022}}</ref>

In 2023, Allen was a coach and judge on [[My Kind of Country (2023 TV series)|''My Kind of Country'']].<ref>{{Cite web |title='My Kind of Country': Mickey Guyton, Jimmie Allen, Orville Peck scout for diverse voices |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/entertainment/music/2023/03/23/my-kind-of-country-apple-tv-plus/11528214002/ |access-date=2023-07-15 |website=USA TODAY |language=en-US}}</ref>

==Personal life==
Allen married his wife, Alexis Gale, in 2021 after the couple had been dating for two years. At the time of their relationship, Allen had a son from a previous relationship and Gale was pregnant with a second child. In April 2023, Allen stated through social media that he and Gale would be separating, and that Gale was pregnant with a third child.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://people.com/country/jimmie-allen-alexis-gale-relationship-timeline/ | title=Jimmie Allen and Alexis Gale's Relationship Timeline | publisher=People | date=April 26, 2023 | accessdate=May 11, 2023}}</ref>

===Lawsuit and termination from record company===
On May 11, 2023, ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' reported that an unnamed former manager of Allen's had filed a lawsuit against him, as well as his management company Wide Open Music and [[Ash Bowers]], who serves as both the owner of Wide Open Music and as Allen's record producer. The manager alleged as part of the claims that Allen had sexually and verbally abused her, and that she had been fired from her role after bringing these allegations to Bowers.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://variety.com/2023/music/news/jimmie-allen-manager-rape-assault-allegations-lawsuit-1235609483/ | title=Country Star Jimmie Allen Sued for Assault and Sexual Abuse by Former Manager (EXCLUSIVE) | publisher=Variety | date=May 11, 2023 | accessdate=May 11, 2023 | author=Elizabeth Wagmeister}}</ref> As a result, Allen's record label, BBR Music Group, suspended the artist effective immediately.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.billboard.com/pro/jimmie-allen-suspended-label-manager-sexual-assault-lawsuit/|title=Country Star Jimmie Allen Suspended by Label Following Sexual Assault Lawsuit From Ex-Manager|author=Melinda Newman|date=May 11, 2023|publisher=Billboard.com|accessdate=May 11, 2023}}</ref> On June 1, 2023, the [[Western Idaho Fair]], held in [[Boise, Idaho]], dropped Allen from scheduled performances on the grandstand lineup and announced that he would not be attending the fair that year.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.idahostatesman.com/entertainment/ent-columns-blogs/words-deeds/article276144991.html|title=Western Idaho Fair cancels grandstand concert after rape lawsuit against country singer|author=Michael Deeds|date=June 6, 2023|publisher=Idahostatesman.com|accessdate=June 7, 2023}}</ref> Further reporting from ''Variety'' on June 8 published similar reports that a second anonymous woman, who stated that she and Allen had a long-distance relationship for several months which culminated in him sexually assaulting her in a [[Las Vegas]] hotel and recording their encounter on his cell phone.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://variety.com/2023/music/news/jimmie-allen-accused-sexual-assault-filming-sex-lawsuit-1235637548/ | title=Country Star Jimmie Allen Accused of Sexual Assault and Making Secret Sex Video Recording by Woman in New Lawsuit | publisher=Variety | date=June 9, 2023 | accessdate=June 9, 2023 | author=Elizabeth Wagmeister}}</ref> Later the same day, ''[[Taste of Country]]'' confirmed that BBR Music Group dropped him as an artist.<ref>{{cite web | url=https://tasteofcountry.com/jimmie-allen-dropped-record-label-bbr/ | title=Jimmie Allen dropped by BBR Music Group after second sexual assault allegation | publisher=[[Taste of Country]] | date=June 9, 2023 | accessdate=June 9, 2023 | author=Billy Dukes}}</ref>

His lawsuits are scheduled to go to trial in November 2024 and March 2025.<ref name=trialdate>{{cite news|url=https://www.delawareonline.com/story/entertainment/music/2024/01/04/delaware-country-star-jimmie-allen-is-accused-of-delaying-sex-assault-case/72109688007/|title=Jimmie Allen's attorneys want to drop him as he fights sex assault cases, trial dates set|first1=Andre|last1=Lamar|first2=Evan|last2=Mealins|publisher=Delaware News Journal|date=January 4, 2024|accessdate=January 4, 2024}}</ref> However, Allen's decision to change lawyers has been seen as an effort to delay litigation.<ref>{{cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/business/legal/jimmie-allen-sexual-assault-accuser-delaying-lawsuit-1235575286/|title=Jimmie Allen Sexual Assault Accuser Says He's Delaying Litigation By Changing Lawyers|first=Bill|last=Donahue|magazine=Billboard|date=January 3, 2023|accessdate=January 4, 2023}}</ref><ref name=trialdate />
